channel.title: .htaccess
channel.description:
[i]HTACCESS[/i] HTACCESS is a file that sits in the root of a directory, and Handles Things to do with:
[ul][li]Site Files[/li] [li]Error Documents[/li] [li]Access[/li] [li]Bot Index Controls[/li] [li]And More.[/li][/ul]
[i]Some Basics[/i]
[ul][li]Only One 'Command' Per Line[/li] [li]Not All Hosts Allow[/li] [li]Its FULL name is .HTACCESS , always.[/li][/ul]
[i]Changing Error Documents Through HTACCESS[/i] First, You need the htaccess file, where allowed. Some hosts dont allow HTACCESS, simply due to the control it can give you. To Change an error Document, use this format [code]ErrorDocument ERRORNO /PATH/DOCUMENT.EXTENSION[/code] so for a custom error 404 document its: [code]ErrorDocument 404 /errors/404.html[/code]
[i]Redirecting[/i] To redirect, theres one simple line to add, [code]Redirect /olddirectory/oldfile.html http://newsite.com/newdirect[/code] So, To stop people going to http://yoursite.com, and make them go to http://www.yoursite.com (for Google PageRank or Preffered URL.) use [code]Redirect http://yoursite.com http://www.yoursite.com/[/code]
[i]Indexing (Enabling/Disabling, Cloaking)[/i] With indexing you can, Hide certain file types, certain file names, or Even Every File. To Stop All files being indexed, Use [code]Options -Indexes[/code] or to Make files all indexed [code]Options +Indexes[/code] (some hosts disable indexing by default.) To Hide a certain type of File: [code]IndexIgnore *.TYPE[/code], and to stop indexing a singe file, [code]IndexIgnore NAME.EXTENSION [/code]
[i]Default Page shown[/i] When You type yoursite.com/directory , the first thing to be shown is normally index.html or .php, To change this use [code]DirectoryIndex FILENAME.EXTENSION[/code]
[i]Password Encrypting Directories[/i] Use This tool http://www.kxs.net/support/htaccess_pw.html to encrypt passwords.
First, In Your HTACCESS File, put:[code]AuthUserFile /.htpasswd location AuthGroupFile /DIRECTORY TO PROTECT AuthName NAME OF AREA TO BE PROTECTED AuthType Basic
require valid-user[/code] In a file called .HTPASSWD, add [code]USERNAME:ENCRYPTEDPASS[/code]
